sense.name: emerge from an egg, chrysalis, etc.
sense.examples: The chick hatched with its feet malformed. Young orb-weaver spiders hatch from eggs and look like tiny adults.

sense.name: incubate; cause to hatch
sense.examples: Jeremy hatched the egg at the next full moon. Zoo Atlanta hatched a rare Arakan forest turtle this week. Can scientists hatch a dinosaur egg? Force-air incubators are large, have a fan, and hatch a larger number of eggs.

sense.name: devise or create
sense.examples: Three Investors Hatch A New Way of Life Doonesbury' and Apple hatched a comic surprise. East Harlem hatched a model for public school choice. Vets hatched a creative plan to lure an elephant to surgery. Jefferson hatched a plot to rob Bradford.

sense.name: mark with thin, closely spaced lines
sense.commentary: Note: The lines or bands may be etched, inlayed, drawn, etc.
sense.examples: The area hatched with plain lines represents the set of points (x, y). The drawing was inked with a brush and hatched with a micron pen. The rapier was hatched with silver.
